009package Ch12_Ransac_Hough;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils.noCurrentImage;
012
013import java.awt.Color;
014import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
015
016import ij.IJ;
017import ij.ImagePlus;
018import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
019import ij.gui.Overlay;
020import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
021import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
022import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
023import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
024import imagingbook.common.hough.HoughLine;
025import imagingbook.common.hough.HoughTransformLines;
026import imagingbook.common.ij.DialogUtils;
027import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
028import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ColoredStroke;
029import imagingbook.common.ij.overlay.ShapeOverlayAdapter;
030import imagingbook.sampleimages.GeneralSampleImage;
031
032/**
033 * <p>
034 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the use of the {@link HoughTransformLines}
035 * class for detecting straight lines in images (see Sec. 12.2 of [1] for
036 * details). It expects a binary input image with background = 0 and foreground
037 * (contour) pixels with values &gt; 0. A vector overlay is used to display the
038 * detected lines. If no image is currently open, the plugin optionally loads a
039 * suitable sample image.
040 * </p>
041 * <p>
042 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
043 * Algorithmic Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
044 * </p>
045 * 
046 * @author WB
047 * @version 2022/10/03
048 */
049public class Hough_Line_Detect implements PlugInFilter {
050
051        private static int MaxLines = 5;                        // number of strongest lines to be found
052        private static int MinPointsOnLine = 50;        // min. number of points on each line
053
054        private static boolean ShowAccumulator = true;
055        private static boolean ShowExtendedAccumulator = false;
056        private static boolean ShowAccumulatorPeaks = false;
057        private static boolean ListStrongestLines = false;
058        private static boolean ShowLines = true;
059        private static boolean InvertOriginal = false;
060        
061        private static double  LineWidth = 0.5;
062        private static Color   LineColor = Color.magenta;
063        
064        private static boolean ShowReferencePoint = true;
065        private static Color   ReferencePointColor = Color.green;
066
067        private ImagePlus im;
068        
069        /**
070         * Constructor, asks to open a predefined sample image if no other image is currently open.
071         */
072        public Hough_Line_Detect() {
073                if (noCurrentImage()) {
074                        DialogUtils.askForSampleImage(GeneralSampleImage.NoisyLines);
075                }
076        }
077        
078        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
079
080        @Override
081        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) {
082                this.im = im;
083                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES;
084        }
085
086        @Override
087        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
088                if (!IjUtils.isBinary(ip)) {
089                        IJ.showMessage("Binary (edge) image required!");
090                        return;
091                }
092
093                HoughTransformLines.Parameters params = new HoughTransformLines.Parameters();
094
095                if (!showDialog(params)) //dialog canceled or error
096                        return; 
097
098                // compute the Hough Transform and retrieve the strongest lines:
099                HoughTransformLines ht = new HoughTransformLines((ByteProcessor)ip, params);
100                HoughLine[] lines = ht.getLines(MinPointsOnLine, MaxLines);
101
102                if (lines.length == 0) {
103                        IJ.log("No lines detected - check the input image and parameters!");
104//                      return;
105                }
106
107                if (ShowAccumulator){
108                        FloatProcessor accIp = ht.getAccumulatorImage();
109                        (new ImagePlus("Accumulator for " + im.getTitle(), accIp)).show();
110                }
111
112                if (ShowExtendedAccumulator){
113                        FloatProcessor accEx = ht.getAccumulatorImageExtended();
114                        (new ImagePlus("Extended accumulator for " + im.getTitle(), accEx)).show();
115                }
116
117                if (ShowAccumulatorPeaks) {
118                        FloatProcessor maxIp = ht.getAccumulatorMaxImage();
119                        (new ImagePlus("Accumulator peaks for " + im.getTitle(), maxIp)).show();
120                }
121
122                if (ListStrongestLines) {
123                        for (int i = 0; i < lines.length; i++) {
124                                IJ.log(i + ": " + lines[i].toString());
125                        }
126                }
127                
128                if (ShowLines) {
129                        ImageProcessor lineIp = ip.duplicate();
130                        if (InvertOriginal) lineIp.invert();
131                        double lineLength = Math.hypot(ip.getWidth(), ip.getHeight());
132                        
133                        Overlay oly = new Overlay();
134                        ShapeOverlayAdapter ola = new ShapeOverlayAdapter(oly);
135                        ola.setStroke(new ColoredStroke(LineWidth, LineColor));
136                        for (HoughLine hl : lines) {
137                                ola.addShape(hl.getShape(lineLength));
138                        }
139                        
140                        if (ShowReferencePoint) {
141                                ola.setStroke(new ColoredStroke(0.5, ReferencePointColor));
142                                ola.addShape(markPoint(ht.getXref(), ht.getYref()));
143                        }
144
145                        ImagePlus lim = new ImagePlus(im.getShortTitle()+"-lines", lineIp);
146                        lim.setOverlay(oly);
147                        lim.show();
148                }
149        }
150
151        // -----------------------------------------------------------------
152
153        private boolean showDialog(HoughTransformLines.Parameters params) {
154                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog("Hough Transform (lines)");
155                gd.addNumericField("Axial steps", params.nAng, 0);
156                gd.addNumericField("Radial steps", params.nRad, 0);
157                gd.addNumericField("Max. number of lines to show", MaxLines, 0);
158                gd.addNumericField("Min. number of points per line", MinPointsOnLine, 0);
159                gd.addCheckbox("Show accumulator", ShowAccumulator);
160                gd.addCheckbox("Show extended accumulator", ShowExtendedAccumulator);
161                gd.addCheckbox("Show accumulator peaks", ShowAccumulatorPeaks);
162                gd.addCheckbox("List strongest lines", ListStrongestLines);
163                gd.addCheckbox("Show lines", ShowLines);
164                gd.addNumericField("Line width", LineWidth, 1);
165                gd.addCheckbox("Show reference point", ShowReferencePoint);
166                
167                gd.showDialog();
168                if(gd.wasCanceled())
169                        return false;
170                
171                params.nAng = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
172                params.nRad = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
173                MaxLines = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
174                MinPointsOnLine = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
175                ShowAccumulator = gd.getNextBoolean();
176                ShowExtendedAccumulator = gd.getNextBoolean();
177                ShowAccumulatorPeaks = gd.getNextBoolean();
178                ListStrongestLines = gd.getNextBoolean();
179                ShowLines = gd.getNextBoolean();
180                LineWidth = gd.getNextNumber();
181                ShowReferencePoint = gd.getNextBoolean();
182                
183                if(gd.invalidNumber()) {
184                        IJ.showMessage("Error", "Invalid input number");
185                        return false;
186                }
187                return true;
188        }
189        
190        private Path2D markPoint(double xc, double yc) {
191                double markerSize = 2.0;
192                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
193                path.moveTo(xc - markerSize, yc);
194                path.lineTo(xc + markerSize, yc);
195                path.moveTo(xc, yc - markerSize);
196                path.lineTo(xc, yc + markerSize);
197                return path;
198        }
199
200}
